intro: Thlaspi glaucum, commonly known as whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is characterized by its basal rosette of blue-green leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a raceme and bloom in early spring. Thlaspi glaucum is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
